alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 8:12PM CDT until April 27 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FOR LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...For late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 84.0 feet, Minor flooding will occur near the creek. Bike paths downstream of the gage will be flooded. Water approaches ball fields at Emmett Conrad High School. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 72.4 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 85.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
